comment._content: how sad, those children may not have had any shoes

comment.author: 51719102@N05
comment._content: A very subdued picture-wonder what was going through the soldier's minds in that moment in time-and the kids watching, just the whole scene-just a great pic!

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Reminds me of an hotel in Naas on the left hand side as you enter from the Dublin Road.  The building looks similar but the main similarity is the creeper and that would not be too reliable.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Lawlor's Hotel? Have checked them on the web, but even without the creeper, the windows are completely different: www.lawlorshotelnaas.com/
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 81374096@N05
comment._content: Its in Bruff Co. Limerick, on the advance on Kilmallock around the 25-29th of July 1922 www.flickr.com/photos/81374096@N05/7457463116/in/photostream

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/81374096@N05] Yes, thanks so much - I spotted a few comments from you 3 weeks ago, but I must apologise for not coming back to you sooner!!
